job.title: Generating, displaying and editing SVG files (ASP .net web forms)
job.description:
The functional scope of an existing application (see below for details) is to be extended to display architectural plans (floor plans) in the browser and (probably also edited - but this is only an option for the time being).

Users upload these plans in the browser, converting the drawings originally available in DWG or DXF format into SVG format (this function is already implemented). The SVG files generated in this way are then displayed in the browser.

The following functions should be available to the user in the browser (in the first expansion stage):
- Zoom in and out of the drawing (using arrow keys and the mouse wheel)
- Pan 

At this point, when displaying the SVG files in the browser, we need external support. The SVG files generated have different dimensions and should all be displayed in such a way that the drawing content fills the screen section and the user does not have to zoom and pan countless times to recognise something. 

It cannot be ruled out that the method of converting the DWG/DXF files into the SVG format will also have to be changed.  

But finding this out is also part of the job

questions.question: Would you say something about your previous experience with editing SVGs in web applications
Are you familiar with editing (especially converting) CAD plans in web applications?
Describe your recent experience with similar projects

customFields.generatedDescriptionAI:
We are looking for a skilled developer to assist us in generating, displaying, and editing SVG files within an ASP .net web forms project. The project is expected to be completed in less than 1 month.

The ideal candidate should have a strong background in the following technologies: .NET Framework, ASP.NET, Microsoft SQL Server, SVG, JavaScript, Web Application, JSON, C#, and jQuery.

To apply for this job, we request that candidates submit a proposal outlining how they can contribute to the project. Specifically, we would like to know how the candidate plans to handle the generation, display, and editing of SVG files within the web forms environment.

Additionally, candidates are encouraged to include links to any relevant past projects that demonstrate their expertise in working with SVG files and ASP .net web forms.
